<|channel|>analysis<|message|>We need to extract Cause_of_Action. We have 13 documents. We should search for cause of action expressions. Usually in complaint, the cause of action is in the introductory paragraph, e.g., "Plaintiff alleges that Defendant's conduct constitutes a violation of Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964". We need to identify distinct causes of action such as "42 U.S.C. § 1983", "Title VII of the Civil Rights Act", "FTC Act", "ADA Title II", "Bivens", etc.

We need to search all documents for patterns that denote cause of action. Could use regex like "§ \d+" or "42 U.S.C." or "Title II of the ADA". But we might just search for "§" or "U.S.C." or "Title" etc. But we need to capture the specific statutory references. The documents are legal filings, so the cause of action will be listed in the complaint. We should search all documents for "§" maybe "42 U.S.C. §" etc.

Better use search_document_regex with pattern that captures "42 U.S.C. § \d+" or "Title \d+ of the Civil Rights Act" etc. But to get all we might just search for patterns like "§" or "U.S.C." or "Title \w+"? But we need distinct values. Might be easier to search for "§" and then parse separate references. However the regex might return many matches across documents.

We can search across all documents for patterns like "(42 U.S.C. § \d+)|(Title \d+ of the Civil Rights Act)|(FTC Act)|(Title II of the ADA)|(Bivens)|(42 U.S.C. § 1983)". But maybe easier to just search for "§" and then manually parse. However we need to provide evidence for each value. Our next action is to search, then read.

We should perform search_document_regex for pattern capturing typical cause of action references. Pattern: (42\sU\.S\.C\. §\s*\d+[a-z]*)|(?:Title\s\d+\sof\sthe\sCivil\sRights\sAct)|(FTC\sAct)|(Title\sII\sof\sthe\sADA)|(Bivens)|(42\sU\.S\.C\. §\s*\d+)

Let's build a pattern: `(42\sU\.S\.C\.\s§\s*\d+[a-z]*|Title\s\d+\sof\sthe\sCivil\sRights\sAct|FTC\sAct|Title\sII\sof\sthe\sADA|Bivens|42\sU\.S\.C\.\s§\s*\d+)`. We'll set flags ignorecase multiline.

We will search all documents. Then parse matches. Let's do search_document_regex with all docs.

<|end|><|start|>assistant<|channel|>commentary to=functions.search_document_regex <|constrain|>json<|message|>{"doc_name":"all","pattern":"(42\\sU\\.S\\.C\\.\\s§\\s*\\d+[a-z]*|Title\\s\\d+\\sof\\sthe\\sCivil\\sRights\\sAct|FTC\\sAct|Title\\sII\\sof\\sthe\\sADA|Bivens|42\\sU\\.S\\.C\\.\\s§\\s*\\d+)","flags":["IGNORECASE","MULTILINE"],"top_k":20,"context_tokens":200}
